intro: Crobylanthe pellacalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Convolvulaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oblong seeds. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in many areas where it is introduced.
